description: This notification is generated when the number of routes received from the BGP peer exceeds the alarm threshold.

event.Summary: BGP peer received count $v1 exceeded alarm threshold of $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerRouteNumThresholdExceed HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum u 9999 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold u 0

description: This object indicates the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum

description: This object indicates the alarm threshold (%) of the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold

description: This notification is generated when the number of routes received from the BGP peer decreases below the alarm threshold.

event.Summary: BGP peer count $v1 decreased below alarm threshold of $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerRouteNumThresholdClear HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum u 9999 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold u 0

description: This object indicates the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum

description: This object indicates the alarm threshold (%) of the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold

description: This notification is generated when the graceful restart status described by hwBgpPeerGRStatus changes.

event.Summary: Graceful restart status changed to $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerGRStatusChange HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerGRStatus i 1

description: Graceful restart status of the BGP peer, including:
1: peerNotBeingHelped, indicating that the BGP peer will not be helped during restarting.
2: peerRestarting, indicating that the BGP peer is detected restarting.
3: peerFinishRestart, indicating that the BGP peer finishes the latest GR.
4: peerHelping, indicating that the BGP peer is helping the local end to perform GR.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerGRStatus

description: This notification is generated when bgp peer session state change from up to down.

event.Summary: BGP peer unavailable due to $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerUnavailable HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionLocalAddrType i 0 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionLocalAddr s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionUnavailableType i 1 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionLocalIfName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionReason i 1

description: Bgp peer session local address type.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionLocalAddrType

description: Bgp peer session local address.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionLocalAddr

description: Bgp peer unavailable type including:
1: Up To Down(1)
2: Always Down(2)
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionUnavailableType

description: Bgp peer session local IFName.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionLocalIfName

description: Bgp peer down reason including:
1: Configuration lead peer down(1)
2: Receive notification(2)
3: Receive error packet(3)
4: Hold timer expire(4)
5: Remote peer not reachable(5)
6: Direct connect-interface down(6)
7: Route limit(7)
8: Peer is not up for a specified long time(8)
100: Alarm clear(100)
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerSessionReason

description: This notification is generated when bgp peer session state change from down to up.

event.Summary: BGP peer available

description: Bgp peer session local IFName.

description: Bgp peer down reason including:

description: This notification is generated when bgp peer session route number exceed.

description: This object indicates the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.

description: This notification is generated when bgp peer session route number exceed clear.

event.Summary: BGP peer session route threshold alarm cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerRouteExceedClear HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum u 9999 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold u 0

description: This object indicates the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitNum

description: This object indicates the alarm threshold (%) of the maximum number of routes received from the BGP peer.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerConfigRouteLimitThreshold

description: This notification is generated when the number of routes
contained by the specified VRF exceeds the value indicated by
mplsL3VpnVrfMidRouteThreshold, and then falls below this value.
A single notification MUST be generated when this threshold is
exceeded, and no other notifications of this type should be issued
until the value of mplsL3VpnVrfPerfCurrNumRoutes has fallen below
that of mplsL3VpnVrfConfMidRteThresh.

event.Summary: VRF route count $v1 dropped below threshold of $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwL3vpnVrfRouteMidThreshCleared MPLS-L3VPN-STD-MIB::mplsL3VpnVrfPerfCurrNumRoutes u 9999 MPLS-L3VPN-STD-MIB::mplsL3VpnVrfConfMidRteThresh u 9999

description: Indicates the number of routes currently used by this
VRF.
variables.name: MPLS-L3VPN-STD-MIB::mplsL3VpnVrfPerfCurrNumRoutes

description: Denotes mid-level water marker for the number
of routes that this VRF may hold.
variables.name: MPLS-L3VPN-STD-MIB::mplsL3VpnVrfConfMidRteThresh

description: The BGP Established event is generated when
the BGP FSM enters the ESTABLISHED state.

event.Summary: BGP FSM entered into established state

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerEstablished HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerLastError s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerState i 1

description: The last error code and subcode seen by this
peer on this connection. If no error has
occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the
first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING
contains the error code, and the second byte
contains the subcode.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerLastError

description: The status of the remote BGP peer, including:
1: Idle(1)
2: Connect(2)
3: Active(3)
4: Opensent(4)
5: Openconfirm(5)
6: Established(6)
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerState

description: The BGPBackwardTransition Event is generated
when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered
state to a lower numbered state.

event.Summary: BGP FSM backward transition state changed to $v2

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerBackwardTransition HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerLastError s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerState i 1 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerUnAvaiReason u 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerBackwardTransition HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerLastError s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerState i 6 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerUnAvaiReason u 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerBackwardTransition HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerLastError s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerState i 2 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerUnAvaiReason u 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

description: The last error code and subcode seen by this
peer on this connection. If no error has
occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the
first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING
contains the error code, and the second byte
contains the subcode.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerLastError

description: The status of the remote BGP peer, including:
1: Idle(1)
2: Connect(2)
3: Active(3)
4: Opensent(4)
5: Openconfirm(5)
6: Established(6)
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerState

description: Bgp peer down reason including:
1: Configuration lead peer down(1)
2: Receive notification(2)
3: Receive error packet(3)
4: Hold timer expire(4)
5: Remote peer not reachable(5)
6: Direct connect-interface down(6)
7: Route limit(7)
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpPeerUnAvaiReason

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: This notification is generated when the number of bgp routes exceeds the threshold.

event.Summary: BGP route count $v2 exceeded threshold of $v3

description: The index of bgp route limit, including:
1. ipv4(1): total ipv4 routes number.
2. ipv6(2): total ipv6 routes number.
3. ipv4vrf(3): ipv4 vrf routes number.
4. ipv6vrf(4): ipv6 vrf routes number.
5. ipv4public(5): ipv4 public routes number.
6. ipv6public(6): ipv6 public routes number.
7. l2ad(7): l2ad routes number.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpRouteLimitindex

variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwBgpProcessName

description: This trap indicates whether the tunnel used by a VPN is reachable
If the tunnel is unreachable, a trap is sent to notify the user, hwTunnelReachablityEvent is 2.
If the tunnel is reachable, a trap is sent to notify the user, hwTunnelReachablityEvent is 1.

Summary.eval: ($v4==1) ? 'VPN $v1 tunnel is reachable' : 'VPN $v1 tunnel is unreachable'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwTnl2VpnTrapEvent HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnId u 9999 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnPublicNextHop a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnTrapCkeyValue u 9999 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwTunnelReachablityEvent u 2

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwTnl2VpnTrapEvent HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnId u 9999 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnPublicNextHop a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnTrapCkeyValue u 9999 HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwTunnelReachablityEvent u 1

description: This object indicates the VPN index.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnId

description: This object indicates the public next-hop address.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnPublicNextHop

description: This object indicates the ckey value.
This value is used for getting next-hop information.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwVpnTrapCkeyValue

description: This object indicates whether the tunnel is reachable.
1--tunnel reachable.
2--tunnel unreachable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwTunnelReachablityEvent

description: This notification is generated when rpki session ROA number exceed.

event.Summary: RPKI session ROA number exceeded limit of $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwRpkiSessionRoaExceed HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwRpkiSessionRoaLimitNum u 9999

description: The limit number of rpki session ROA.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwRpkiSessionRoaLimitNum

description: This notification is generated when rpki session ROA number exceed clear.

event.Summary: RPKI session ROA number limit cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwRpkiSessionRoaExceedClear HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwRpkiSessionRoaLimitNum u 9999

description: The limit number of rpki session ROA.
variables.name: HUAWEI-BGP-VPN-MIB::hwRpkiSessionRoaLimitNum
